column4: Hi guys, I am a current mac user and wanted to experience or try out a Linux distro. People have told me that Ubuntu is very popular among new Linux users.
so was wondering anyone could tell me which version to download
or do I need the i86
What type of mac do you have?
The 32-bit will be fine, you'll be able to better use some proprietary software (like Adobe Flash)
unless you have lots of RAM (>3.5gb), then you'll need the 64bit version to use it all,
It should detect your hardware and work properly
do you mean I need to mor ethna 3.5gb to use 64bit?
If not, come back here and we'll help you out,
No, I'm saying that 32bit only supports about 3.5GB of RAM, if you have more, you need a 64bit OS,
